column5: It's easy, when they too dirty, put them in the classified and we'll clean them up.
Hydrogen percarbonate will clean it right up.
I'm in this fan club!  S.

Over the many years of using cork handle rods, especially if minnow are used like fishing for Lake Erie perch, I have found the very best way to clean the handle and the rest of the rod is to take it in the shower with you.  A lite SOS pad on ONLY the cork will bring it back to new in about 1 minute and then using a wash cloth with soap will get most of the minnow scales off the rest of the rod. Don't use anything but soap and a wash cloth on the rod blank or you will take off the finish.

Over the many years of using cork handle rods, especially if minnow are used like fishing for Lake Erie perch, I have found the very best way to clean the handle and the rest of the rod is to take it in the shower with you. X2 for me.

Make sure you soak it    http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x3fuia_italian-cork-soakers_fun

Make sure you soak it    http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x3fuia_italian-cork-soakers_fun That's funny, I was thinking of this thread and just went through it to make sure someone didn't beat me to it, but rodbender, you did. Good little SNL skit years back.....

I have a custom made rod that was given to me for Christmas by my staff about 20 years ago, I love this rod, not only is it an excellent rod but it means a lot to me. The cork is getting very grey and old looking and I would like to refresh it but I'm not sure how or what to do.  I know we have many experts on here so I thought perhaps someone could tell me the best way to do it.  All help would be much appreciated!
Bleach and rag does the trick for me...  Josh
Check this out:     Regards, Snowball
I've used a little dish soap and a gentle brush and that has worked. I'm willing to try the alcohol suggested above.
used mr clean magic erasers with success
^^^^^^ this. Magic eraser
Kickingfrog, you're always willing to try alcohol. I'll see myself out....
x3 magic eraser  Michael
I use magic eraser as well. Works great. A light sanding works well too. After that, if you can find some u40 cork sealer, it will prevent it from getting as dirty afterwards.
Yup 30 seconds with a wet magic eraser and she's purdy again
Poor Cliff must feel tired right now from dodging all the magic eraser sponges getting tossed at him!  MIchael
Magic erasers  They do a great job
Who cleans away character??
Who cleans away character??  DING DING WINNER
Sometimes I buy used and want my own "character" on it  Lol  I finish with a vin/water wash to remove residue.
Who cleans away character?? I guess the same people that wash their cars or boats LOL. I love this rod and just want to take care of it.  Thanks for the suggestions, I'll give the magic eraser a try!
I find myself always washing my hands off in the water and wipe my handles the same with a towel. 99% of my cork handles look new.  I hate roe goooo on my handles
Thinking the same thing...
Who cleans away character??  Exactly.  That's why I like cork instead of synthetic foam/ plastic crap handles. Battle scars and history.
little light sanding would do the trick
Magic eraser and a little water, removed the dirt, left the battle scars. Thanks for the help!
I always clean the cork on my rods, character be damned, lol.   A little soap/water and some elbow grease.   Dirty cork never looks good no matter how many fish you've landed.
Warm water and magic eraser on all my cork handles every spring, works great!

My small stream rods have pretty dirty cork, as I like to chase trouties with worms so the handles get dark with worm dirt in no time.  I love taking the Magic Erasure to them and having 'em look nice and new again( until the next trout trip .. lol ).

ya'll are crazy!!!  first it was how to clean the carpet in your boat....now its how to clean the cork on your rod....  Do you guys wash and clean your lures as well?  Or maybe next its how to clean your survival suit...  :)
